jhelp.gui

Class JHelpAutoStyledTextArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
            • javax.swing.JEditorPane
              • jhelp.gui.JHelpAutoStyledTextArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class JHelpAutoStyledTextArea
extends javax.swing.JEditorPane
    Text area with automatic styling while typing text.
    It detects each words. If a word have an associated style, we use the associated style else the default style.
    Symbols [](){}&|\"'-@=/\*+.,?;:!<> can have also their own style
    You have first register a style with createStyle(String, String, int, boolean, boolean, boolean, Color, Color) then associate words with associate(String, String...), setSymbolStyle(String) (for symbol) or setDefaultStyle(String) (for change default style)
    The key short cut format is actually hard coded to Ctrl+Shift+F
    Last modification : 23 sept. 2010
    Version 0.0.0
    Author:
    JHelp
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
